I would consider the type of lightning rather than the distance to observe a difference in sound. The sharp cracks that are short lived come from CG strikes (cloud to ground), the long rumbling ones are from IC strike (intra cloud) which traverse the sky horizontally which give more credit to the idea that the distance gives a difference in duration of thunder. The maximum duration for the thunder from a vertical strike is the total time of the visible bolt (excluding echo/reverb/pulsing).
